skill.name: device-management
skill.description: Manage device adoption and onboarding, maintain device inventory, and monitor device configurations across your UniFi Protect infrastructure.
skill.summary: Manage device adoption and onboarding, maintain device inventory, and monitor device configurations ...
skill.author: DataKnifeAI

security_audit.summary: This skill manages UniFi Protect surveillance devices through network API calls. It requires valid UniFi credentials and makes external network requests to the UniFi controller. The skill itself is a documentation layer describing MCP tools that perform the actual operations.

medium_findings.title: Network API access to surveillance system
medium_findings.description: This skill requires network access to UniFi Protect controllers via API calls. It needs UNIFI_BASE_URL and UNIFI_API_KEY to function, which could potentially access sensitive surveillance data including camera feeds, motion events, and device configurations.

low_findings.title: Docker registry uses custom Harbor instance
low_findings.description: The Docker configuration references a custom Harbor registry (harbor.dataknife.net) instead of official Docker Hub images. This could introduce supply chain risks if the registry is compromised.

content.value_statement: Keep track of all your security cameras and devices in one place. Monitor device status and plan upgrades efficiently with automated inventory management.
actual_capabilities: List all UniFi Protect cameras and their status
Maintain device inventory with MAC addresses and IPs
Monitor device configurations and firmware versions
limitations: Requires valid UniFi Protect API credentials
Only works with UniFi Protect systems
Cannot adopt devices directly - provides planning data
Network access to UniFi controller required

use_cases.title: Surveillance device inventory
use_cases.description: Maintain comprehensive inventory of all security cameras, sensors, and devices across multiple locations.

use_cases.title: Device upgrade planning
use_cases.description: Plan hardware refresh cycles by analyzing device age, performance, and firmware versions.

use_cases.title: New device onboarding
use_cases.description: Streamline adoption process for new cameras and sensors with automated discovery and documentation.

best_practices: Review device inventory weekly to catch offline devices quickly
Document device locations and purposes for easier management
Plan adoptions in logical groups by building or area
anti_patterns: Don't ignore offline devices - investigate connectivity issues promptly
Avoid adopting devices without proper documentation and naming
Don't skip firmware updates - they contain important security patches

faq.question: What UniFi Protect versions are supported?
faq.answer: Requires UniFi Protect 3.x or later with API access enabled, and UniFi Controller 7.x or later.

faq.question: How many devices can this skill manage?
faq.answer: No specific limit - scales with your UniFi Protect system's capacity.

faq.question: Can I adopt devices directly through this skill?
faq.answer: The skill provides device discovery and inventory data. Actual adoption must be done through UniFi Protect interface.

faq.question: Is my surveillance data secure?
faq.answer: The skill only reads device metadata and status. Video feeds and recordings remain on your UniFi Protect system.

faq.question: Why can't I see any devices?
faq.answer: Verify your API key and base URL are correct. Check that your UniFi Protect system is accessible from your network.

faq.question: How does this compare to UniFi's native interface?
faq.answer: This skill provides AI-powered analysis and planning capabilities that complement UniFi's management interface.
